title: Parramatta business school hits Forbes MBA list
text:
Students at the school are attached to local businesses and given real-world case studies to work on.

"We have students from over 15 different countries in our postgraduate classes and this adds a lot more depth and dimension to the learning experience," Mr Jain said.

He said the one-year Master of Business Administration had become more popular than the two-year MBA.

Careers and financial motivation remain the top two areas of focus for at least a decade after graduation. — Nitish Jain, SP Jain School of Management

"The cost [of two year degrees] is way too high and not compensated enough by higher salaries. Moreover, students want more flexibility and taking two years out of work to study is just not possible in today’s competitive job market."

He rejected a suggestion that the one-year MBA did not allow enough time to fully get across business management issues.

"Most two-year courses comprise 16 months of academic instruction, compared with 12 months for a one-year course.

"One-year courses are designed to be efficient, accelerated and rigorous, without any drop in the learning quality or academic experience."

Advertisement

On Friday The Australian Financial Review 2019 BOSS MBA rankings revealed the stand-out motive for business students in Australia was expanding career horizons, working more effectively and building confidence.

Mr Jain said in the case of SP Jain School of Management, 90 per cent of students had taken bank loans to join the course and until they had repaid their debts their focus was on salaries. After that many of them would "focus on their calling".

"For most, however, careers and financial motivation remain the top two areas of focus for at least a decade after graduation."

The school has a total of 730 students and one of the lowest acceptance rates in the world, it takes just 13 per cent of applications.
description: The SP Jain school has 100 per cent foreign enrolment.
